functions.name: browse

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server to browse. None to browse all servers

params.name: device
params.description: The name of the device to browse

params.name: folderPath
params.description: Filters on folder path. Use '*' for any number of characters and '?' for a single character

params.name: opcItemPath
params.description: Filters on OPC item path. Use '*' for any number of characters and '?' for a single character

returns.description: A list of OPCBrowseTag objects with getOpcServer(), getOpcItemPath(), getType(), getDisplayName(), getDisplayPath(), getDataType() methods

functions.description: Browses OPC servers in the runtime, returning a list of tags.
functions.long_description: Performs a fully recursive browse of OPC servers in the runtime. Warning: this browse cannot be terminated once started, which can be problematic in larger systems. Consider using system.opc.browseServer() instead for controlled, single-level browsing.
examples: tags = system.opc.browse(opcServer='Ignition OPC UA Server', device='SLC')

functions.name: browseServer

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server connection

params.name: nodeId
params.description: The node ID to browse. Use empty string for root, or a path like 'Devices' to browse devices

returns.description: A list of browse element objects with getDisplayName(), getElementType(), getNodeId(), and getDatatype() methods

functions.description: Browses a single level of an OPC server, returning child nodes for the given node ID.
functions.long_description: Performs a single-level (non-recursive) browse of an OPC server at the specified node ID. Unlike system.opc.browse(), this function only returns immediate children, making it safe for large OPC servers. Call repeatedly to navigate the server tree. In Vision Client scope, returns OPCBrowseElement objects; in Gateway/Perspective scope, returns PyOPCTagEx objects.
examples:
opcServer = 'Ignition OPC UA Server'
devices = system.opc.browseServer(opcServer, 'Devices')
for device in devices:
    print device.getDisplayName()

# Browse a specific device's tags
results = system.opc.browseServer('Ignition OPC UA Server', 'ns=1;s=[SLC]')
for r in results:
    print r.getDisplayName(), r.getNodeId()

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server to browse

params.name: device
params.description: The name of the device to browse

params.name: folderPath
params.description: Filters on folder path. Use '*' for any number of characters and '?' for a single character

params.name: opcItemPath
params.description: Filters on OPC item path. Use '*' for any number of characters and '?' for a single character

returns.description: A list of OPCBrowseTag objects with getOpcServer(), getOpcItemPath(), getType(), getDisplayName(), getDisplayPath(), getDataType() methods

functions.description: Browses OPC servers in the runtime, returning a list of tags. All parameters are required but can be None.
functions.long_description: Similar to system.opc.browse() but requires all four parameters (they can be set to None). Performs a fully recursive browse that cannot be terminated. For large systems, use system.opc.browseServer() instead for controlled browsing.

functions.name: getServers

params.name: includeDisabled
params.description: When True, returns both enabled and disabled servers. When False, returns only enabled servers

returns.description: A list of OPC server connection names

functions.description: Returns a list of configured OPC server connection names.

functions.name: getServerState

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of an OPC server connection

returns.description: The connection state: UNKNOWN, FAULTED, CONNECTING, CLOSED, CONNECTED, or DISABLED. Returns None if the connection doesn't exist

functions.description: Returns the current state of the given OPC server connection.
functions.long_description: Retrieves the current operational state of a specified OPC server connection. Possible states are: UNKNOWN, FAULTED, CONNECTING, CLOSED, CONNECTED, and DISABLED. Returns None if the named connection does not exist.
examples:
allServers = system.opc.getServers()
message = 'Server State:\n'
for server in allServers:
    message += server + ': ' + system.opc.getServerState(server) + '\n'
print message

functions.name: isServerEnabled

params.name: serverName
params.description: The name of an OPC server connection

returns.description: True if the connection is enabled, False if disabled

functions.description: Checks if an OPC server connection is enabled or disabled.

functions.name: readValue

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server connection

params.name: itemPath
params.description: The item path or address to read from the OPC server

returns.description: An object with value, quality, and timestamp. Use getValue(), getQuality().isGood(), and getTimestamp() to access

functions.description: Reads a single value directly from an OPC server connection.
functions.long_description: Reads the current value of a single OPC item directly from the server. Returns a QualifiedValue object containing the value, a quality code, and the server timestamp. Use getQuality().isGood() to check if the read was successful before using the value.
examples:
server = 'Ignition OPC UA Server'
path = '[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:0'
qv = system.opc.readValue(server, path)
print 'Value:', qv.getValue()
print 'Quality:', qv.getQuality().isGood()
print 'Timestamp:', qv.getTimestamp()

functions.name: readValues

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server connection

params.name: itemPaths
params.description: A list of item paths or addresses to read from the OPC server

returns.description: A list of QualifiedValue objects in the same order as the requested item paths

functions.description: Reads multiple values directly from an OPC server connection in bulk.
functions.long_description: Bulk version of system.opc.readValue(). Reads multiple OPC items in a single call, which is more efficient than reading one at a time. Returns a list of QualifiedValue objects in the same order as the input item paths.
examples:
paths = ['[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:0', '[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:1']
values = system.opc.readValues('Ignition OPC UA Server', paths)
for qv in values:
    print qv.getValue(), qv.getQuality().isGood()

functions.name: setServerEnabled

params.name: serverName
params.description: The name of an OPC server connection

params.name: enabled
params.description: True to enable the server connection, False to disable it

functions.description: Enables or disables an OPC server connection.
functions.long_description: Enables or disables an OPC server connection by name. Requires the OPC Server Management client permission in Vision/Perspective scope. Gateway scope is unrestricted.
examples:
# Enable a specific server
system.opc.setServerEnabled('Ignition OPC UA Server', True)

functions.name: writeValue

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server connection

params.name: itemPath
params.description: The item path or address to write to

params.name: value
params.description: The value to write to the OPC item

returns.description: A Quality object representing the write result. Call isGood() to verify success

functions.description: Writes a value directly through an OPC server connection synchronously.
functions.long_description: Writes a single value to an OPC item address and returns a Quality object indicating the result. This is a synchronous operation â€” the function blocks until the write completes. Requires OPC Server Management client permission in Vision/Perspective scope.
examples:
server = 'Ignition OPC UA Server'
path = '[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:0'
result = system.opc.writeValue(server, path, 42)
if result.isGood():
    print 'Write successful'
else:
    print 'Write failed'

functions.name: writeValues

params.name: opcServer
params.description: The name of the OPC server connection

params.name: itemPaths
params.description: A list of item paths or addresses to write to

params.name: values
params.description: A list of values to write, corresponding to each item path

returns.description: A list of Quality objects in the same order as the provided addresses, each indicating the write result

functions.description: Writes multiple values directly through an OPC server connection in bulk.
functions.long_description: Bulk version of system.opc.writeValue(). Writes multiple values to OPC item addresses in a single call, which is more efficient than writing one at a time. Requires OPC Server Management client permission in Vision/Perspective scope.
examples:
server = 'Ignition OPC UA Server'
paths = ['[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:0', '[SLCSim]_Meta:N7/N7:1']
values = [42, 100]
results = system.opc.writeValues(server, paths, values)
for i, r in enumerate(results):
    print paths[i], 'OK' if r.isGood() else 'FAILED'
